Class Session

java.lang.Object
main.java.com.journalapp.util.Session
public final class Session extends Object
Represent a user session.

  • Method Details

    • hasActiveUser

      public static boolean hasActiveUser()
      Check if there is user logged in currently.
      Returns:
      true if there is user logged in. false if otherwise

    • signup

      public static boolean signup(String username, String email, String password)
      Create and record a new user. Then if successful, login to the newly created account.
      Returns:
      true if signup success. false if user already exists

    • login

      public static boolean login(String email, String password)
      Login into existing user account with given email and password.

      Suggestion: If this method returns false, display the message "Incorrect email and password combination". For the sake of simplicity, I am not including a way to tell the cause of login failure, e.g. is the email entered not registered? or is the password incorrect?

      Returns:
      true if login success. false if otherwise

    • logout

      public static void logout()
      Log out current user/remove active user.

    • getUsername

      public static String getUsername()
      Return the username of current logged account. Use this for addressing the user.
      Returns:
      string representing username

    • getEmail

      public static String getEmail()
      Return the email address of current logged account.
      Returns:
      string representing email address

    • getPassword

      public static String getPassword()
      Return the password of current logged account.
      Returns:
      string representing password

    • listEntries

      public static ArrayList<main.java.com.journalapp.model.Entry> listEntries()
      Return list of existing journal entries saved previously for the current logged user.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing Entry objects representing individual entries

    • createEntry

      public static void createEntry(LocalDate date, String content, String mood, String weather)
      Create and save entry for the current logged user.
      Parameters:
      date - the date for this entry. type of LocalDate
      content - string of content for this entry
      mood - "Very Positive", "Positive", "Neutral", "Negative", or "Very Negative". hint: call MoodAnalyzer.analyze(content)
      weather - "Sunny", "Rainy", "Hazy", or "Thunderstorms". hint: call Weather.getCurrentWeather

    • deleteEntry

      public static void deleteEntry(String id)
      Delete an entry with the given id. (Irreversible, use at caution)
      Parameters:
      id - id of target entry

    • editEntry

      public static void editEntry(String id, LocalDate date, String content, String mood, String weather)
      Edit existing entry given the id of that entry, and also the contents to be written.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique id for that entry
      date - the date for that entry. type of LocalDate
      content - string of content for that entry
      mood - "Very Positive", "Positive", "Neutral", "Negative", or "Very Negative". hint: call MoodAnalyzer.analyze(content)
      weather - "Sunny", "Rainy", "Hazy", or "Thunderstorms". hint: call Weather.getCurrentWeather
